185635818.review: Ho iniziato su PlayStation nel 2019 con più di 200 ore, po dal 2021 su Xbox con 125 ore, poi, l'ho comprato anche qui su Steam più o meno nel 2022 ma non l'ho mai giocato molto qua come potete vedere, però ieri mi sono accorto di non averlo neanche mai platinato qui quindi oggi l'ho fatto. Di certo uno dei migliori giochi play for fun della storia. Magari anche qua se ho tempo lo porto sopra le 100h, al massimo modifico il commento aggiornando anche l'orario di gioco. Comunque sia che lo giochiate con amici o da soli non vi annoierete di certo e mi auguro non muoia mai come gioco e che lo aggiornino sempre. Ciao! (15/01/2025)

185228811.review:
After being a long-time player of Overwatch and abandoning it due to the many issues with the game and Blizzard Activision, I've wanted a game that felt like its beginning. Marvel Rivals is that game--and more. It's very much a lot of fun to play, I love the engagement and art style. It's not perfect, but it's good.

Pros:
Familiar characters
Lovely art style
Free to play!
Reasonable battle pass

Cons:
Memory leaks (for now, hopefully they'll fix it)
Poor optimization
Competitive begins at bottom rather than placement matches
Cosmetics in store are pricey

185165671.review: Gang Beasts is one of if not, one of my favorite games to play with my friends. it’s super funny and we have a really good time playing it. I can think of countless times where I hit my friend in the head with a barrel and countless times I’ve been hitting the head with a barrel and then got thrown off the map because I suck. Actually, I don’t suck, my friends are just pretty good. I’ve been playing this since 2022 and knew it since I was like eight and it’s still one of my favorite games to play with my friends. you can customize your own character, beat the crap out of your friends, keep playing the same Maps over and over, and it never gets old. I’ve made a lot of memories playing this, and I hope to make more. Gang beasts is an 9/10.

184957743.review:
Gang Beasts is a laugh-out-loud party game with wacky physics and chaotic brawls. Its colorful maps and unpredictable gameplay are perfect for playing with friends, whether locally or online. The controls can feel clunky at first, but they add to the charm. If you’re after silly fun, this game delivers!

Rating: 8.5/10

184697336.review: Gang Beasts is a fun and chaotic fighting game that you can play with your friends. The game stands out with its colorful and humorous character designs, and its simple controls and physics-based gameplay appeal to players of all ages. However, sometimes the controls can be unresponsive, and there can be issues with camera angles. Nevertheless, it's a perfect choice for having a great time with your friends.

184687431.review: Dowloand the game Watch 2 tutorials How to play it. Then try them and bum its your favorite game (needs a discount 19 euro is too much) but its a great game. (i m the best player in the game)

184686102.review: Спустя 87 часов в игре я могу объективно высказать мнение об этой игре. Местами игра интересная и весёлая особенно когда играешь с друзьями, но главная проблема этой игры в том, что станы ( оглушения ) проходят МАКСИМАЛЬНО без логики, вы можете хоть 40 раз вставать и бить противника 1 кнопкой и ему ничего не будет даже спусти сотню ударов, а он в свою очередь этой же кнопок с одного удара даст вам стан. По началу игра будет интересной и забавной, но в конце концов вас станет очень раздражать механика в этой игре. На самом деле посоветовал бы поискать более достойные аналоги, либо схожие жанром.

184658495.review:
----- Gráficos ----------
🔲O preço que se paga por enxergar é olhar essa coisa horrorosa
✅️Aceitável, dá pra jogar
🔲Bom
🔲Muito bom
🔲Cada frame foi pintado por Michelangelo

----- Requisitos ---------
✅️Roda até no seu pai
🔲Um notebook da positivo tanka
🔲Um pc que não saia fumaça no menu
🔲i5 com uma GTX 1050 é uma boa
🔲Precisa de um pc bom, no mínimo um gtx 1080
🔲i9 12900k com RTX4090 ligadas numa máquina que gera energia para o planeta todo

----- História ----------
✅️Esqueceram de criar kkkkkk
🔲Rapaz, parece ter algo pra contar
🔲Uma história bacaninha até
🔲A História é boa!
🔲É sobre a realidade humana...
🔲Direção de Christopher Nolan!
🔲Escrita enquanto o papel, a caneta e o escritor pegavam fogo!

----- Jogabilidade ------
🔲Uma ofensa pra quem joga
🔲Ruim demais
🔲Aceitável
✅Jogabilidade bacaninha
🔲Jogabilidade excelente!

----- Complexidade ------
✅Até minha avó que não sabe o que é ''mouse'' consegue
🔲Fácil de entender
🔲Fácil de aprender, difícil de dominar
🔲Exige uma faculdade
🔲Precisa de, no mínimo, 10 doutorados e uma bacharelado

------ Dificuldade -------
🔲Você escolhe a dificuldade
✅Tranquilinho, fácil
🔲médio. Tem aquelas pequenas dificuldades que dão uma ótima gameplay
🔲Quase Dead Cells
🔲Dead Cells
🔲difícil como Elden Ring
🔲Elden Ring DEMAIS
🔲Você precisa de 4 cérebros pra pensar rápido e 8 mãos.

------- Tempo de jogo -----------
✅Dá pra jogar enquanto ouve músicas e lê
🔲6h, curtinho até
🔲12h, dá pra jogar bem
🔲30h, Mundo aberto com quests boas
🔲50h, O jogo é cheio de coisa pra fazer, embora não seja mundo aberto. (Pra platinar pega umas 80hrs)
🔲100h+, história, mundo aberto e platina loooonga
🔲Você começa, seu tataraneto termina
🔲Infinitoooooooooooooooo
------- Áudio, músicas -----------
🔲Poluição sonora
✅Dá pra jogar se esforçando um pouco pra gostar
🔲Aceitável
🔲Muito bom
🔲Mozart e Beethoven fizeram juntos a composição dessa obra de arte musical, que DELEITE!

------- Bugs ----------------------
🔲Nunca vi
✅Pequenos bugs que aparecem vez ou outra, mas não atrapalham
🔲Pode ficar estressante
🔲Pode arruinar qualquer diversão aqui

------ Publico --------------------
🔲Crianças
🔲Adolescentes
🔲Adultos
✅️Tudo e todos

------ Multiplayer -------
🔲Não possui
🔲Injogável
✅Vai ficar mordido de raiva (não tem server br)
🔲Lag quase imperceptível.
🔲Desconheço a palavra lag aqui, pode jogar

------ Compensa Comprar? -------
🔲É DE GRAÇAAAAAAAAA
🔲Preço justo, pode comprar
🔲Compre se tiver dinheiro sobrando

Isso me obriga a perder algum tempo ajustando o áudio sempre que inicio o jogo.

184464251.review:
Gang Beasts is a multiplayer game that delivers pure fun and unrestrained chaos. With its unique style of colorful graphics and wobbly, gelatinous characters. The goal is simple: be the last one standing. 
The intentionally clumsy controls add a hilarious layer of challenge as you struggle to toss your opponents off perilous platforms or avoid being taken out by the environment itself. Every match is packed with unpredictable moments that spark laughter and excitement, especially when playing with friends.
It’s perfect for quick casual sessions or entire nights of laughter and fun.
If you're looking for a game that's easy to pick up, packed with absurd humor, and guaranteed to entertain players of all ages, Gang Beasts is a must-have. Get ready to lose, laugh, and keep coming back for more!

184145610.review: Gang Warfare can be a very touchy subject and is almost always done poorly or distastefully within media. This game masterfully emphazises the cruel nature of systemic oppression in 21st century America and puts a charming and very colorful twist on it; and manages to find its way into all of our hearts. The player finds themselfs in fimiliar hip hoodlum settings like the Bronx and Chicago. The repetitive usage of birds in these settings perhaps highlight NYCPD’s use of these drones to lockup our brothers for things like “aggravated assault” and “assault on an officer.” All to keep a strangle hold of our neighborhoods and a foot on our necks. Besides Pidgeons, a Shark happens to be the only other that can be observed in this Game. Sharks are often seen as symbols of power, dominance, and resilience in the natural world. In many cultures, they are feared for their strength and their position at the top of the food chain. Similarly, the Black Panther Party (BPP) sought to embody strength and empowerment for African Americans, particularly in the face of systemic racism. This art form of expressionistic societal deconstructionism breaths a breath of life into the gaming world and pushes the envelope on modern digital media.

183903123.review:
A small and simple party game about killing your friends through any means necessary. Not that many maps but the ones the game has does the concept justice and being visually and gameplay wise distinct. The style of the game is very cartoony and the animal onesies of everyone is quite cute while differentiating everyone so you don’t lose track of who you are.

Controls are quite wonky but if used effectively you can achieve some hilarious outcomes or just outsmart the other players by getting to places they can’t. There are other modes than brawl but I don’t see anyone buying the game for those ones. Overall a fun party games for an hour or two if you have friends or family coming over. Simple enough for basically anyone to play but high enough motor skill ceiling to have a tournament. I’d say it’s only really worth grabbing on sale as the standard asking price is probably too much for what the game delivers.

183822941.review:
¡Oh, almas errantes que en vuestra infinita curiosidad os acercáis a este relato, escuchad con atención las palabras que os he de contar! En tiempos oscuros, cuando los cielos se teñían de gris y el viento soplaba con fuerza sobre las tierras de los hombres, surgió una contienda de tal naturaleza que ni los más sabios sabrían de qué hablar, pues no era lucha de honor ni de sangre, sino de desdicha y risas perdidas en el vaivén del destino. Hablo de Gang Beasts, un juego cuya esencia se forjó no en la fragua de la guerra, sino en las mentes de los dioses burlones, aquellos de Boneloaf, que en su arte trajeron al mundo una prueba como ninguna otra.

En esta singular arena de combate, donde el sentido de la dignidad no tiene cabida y la elegancia del héroe se disuelve en el caos, los luchadores no son hombres ni bestias, sino criaturas grotescas, cuyos cuerpos están compuestos de formas torpes y movimientos erráticos, semejantes a los movimientos de un muñeco de trapo que danza bajo el capricho de las fuerzas invisibles. En este retorcido juego, no se alzan espadas ni lanzas, ni se agitan escudos en busca de gloria; en Gang Beasts, las armas son las manos de estos luchadores que, como los antiguos gladiadores, combaten no con destreza, sino con la voluntad de sobrevivir al desorden.

Las tierras sobre las cuales estos seres se enfrentan no son arenas llanas ni campos de batalla establecidos, sino plataformas flotantes que se alzan en lo alto del vacío, o fábricas maltrechas, cuyo destino parece tan incierto como el mismo camino de la vida. ¡Oh, cuán inestable es el suelo en Gang Beasts! Los luchadores no solo deben temer a sus adversarios, sino al mismo terreno, que bajo sus pies cede con la misma frecuencia que un castillo de arena ante la marea. Y así, mientras luchan, el terreno se quiebra, las plataformas se desmoronan, y los cuerpos caen en la nada con la misma rapidez que el sol se oculta al final del día.

Los guerreros de Gang Beasts no luchan como antaño los caballeros, pues no es la fuerza la que prevalece, sino la comedia del combate, un espectáculo donde el mayor enemigo no es el oponente, sino el propio destino, que juega con ellos, burlándose de sus esfuerzos. Un combate, oh lector, podría verse ganado no por el más fuerte, sino por aquel que logra no caer, por aquel que, con una risueña torpeza, es capaz de resistir el embate del azar. ¡Y qué extraña es esta lucha! El combate no es regido por estrategia ni por destreza, sino por la misma suerte que favorece al errante y se mofa del sabio.

Mas, ¡oh, qué diversión se desprende de esta locura! Cada round, cual giro de la rueda del destino, es un nuevo desafío, y los combatientes, lejos de hallar su honra en la victoria, la buscan en el desastre, pues cada caída es celebrada con la risa, cada error es un triunfo por sí mismo. Los guerreros caen, se levantan, caen de nuevo, y siempre con la esperanza de que en este vaivén, en este torbellino de desorden y torpeza, hallarán la victoria.

Las criaturas que en Gang Beasts luchan no tienen la solemnidad de los héroes de antaño, sino la ligereza de aquellos que se entregan al caos sin temer la vergüenza de sus caídas. Los luchadores, cuales campesinos que toman las armas sin conocerlas, no se enfrentan con la sabiduría de los antiguos, sino con la desesperación de aquellos que no saben si ganan o pierden, pero se entregan, sin más, al torbellino de lo absurdo. Y, sin embargo, en esta extraña lucha, no importa cuánto se caiga ni cuántas veces el cuerpo se desplome, pues lo que importa, al final, es el goce en la lucha misma, la satisfacción en el desenfreno y el desorden.

En Gang Beasts, la batalla no tiene fin, como el ciclo eterno de la vida y la muerte. Los luchadores, cual animales salvajes, se entregan a un juego sin razón ni lógica, donde cada derrota es seguida por un nuevo intento, y cada intento, por otro más. Y así, como en las antiguas leyendas, la guerra nunca cesa, la lucha sigue, y la risa resuena en el aire como la melodía de un destino que no entiende de honor ni gloria.

Por tanto, si algún día os atrevéis a entrar en el dominio de Gang Beasts, sabed que no hallaréis la dignidad ni la honra, sino el caos, el juego y la torpeza. La victoria en este campo no es más que una ilusión, pues la verdadera victoria es aquella que se halla en la risa, en el desorden y en la celebración de lo absurdo. Y así, como en los días más oscuros, la batalla continúa, siempre sin fin, siempre absurda, siempre regida por el capricho del destino, mientras los luchadores caen y se levantan una vez más, en busca de una gloria que nunca llega, pero que nunca deja de ser deseada.

183588803.review:
Gang Beasts is a hilariously chaotic party game that thrives on its ridiculousness. Developed by Boneloaf, this multiplayer brawler offers a unique blend of humor, unpredictability, and fun, making it an excellent choice for a game night with friends.

[h2]Gameplay[/h2]
The core gameplay of Gang Beasts revolves around battling it out with other players in a variety of colorful, absurd arenas. The controls are intentionally wobbly and imprecise, which adds to the comedic nature of the game. Whether you're flailing your arms to throw punches or desperately clinging to a ledge, the physics-based mechanics ensure that every match is unpredictable and full of laughs.

The game supports local and online multiplayer, but it truly shines in couch co-op. There's something special about the shared laughter (and occasional frustration) that comes from seeing your character flop around or accidentally throw themselves into danger.

[h2]Graphics and Sound[/h2]
Gang Beasts features a charming, minimalist art style that suits its lighthearted tone. The gelatinous character models are adorably goofy, and the environments are filled with quirky details that enhance the fun. From a Ferris wheel to a meat grinder, the arenas are as dangerous as they are entertaining.

The sound design complements the chaos perfectly. The squishy noises, exaggerated impacts, and silly background music amplify the absurdity of each match.

[h2]Replayability[/h2]
What makes Gang Beasts a standout party game is its replayability. No two matches are ever the same, thanks to the unpredictable physics and variety of maps. However, the game could benefit from more modes and customization options to keep things fresh for long-term players.

[h2]Pros[/h2]
Hilarious, physics-based gameplay
Perfect for playing with friends
Simple controls that anyone can pick up
Vibrant and creative arenas
[h2]Cons[/h2]
Limited game modes and customization
Can feel repetitive after extended play sessions
Online multiplayer occasionally suffers from lag
[h2]Final Thoughts[/h2]
Gang Beasts is a gem for anyone looking to inject laughter and chaos into their gaming sessions. While it might not have the depth of some other multiplayer games, its charm lies in its simplicity and the sheer joy of flailing your way to victory. If you’re planning a game night with friends, Gang Beasts is a must-try.

Rating: 8/10
It’s not perfect, but it’s a guaranteed good time.
